title: KiWi - A platform for building Semantic Social Media Applications
segmentation: Good morning everyone and welcome to the presentation on Kiwi.
The Kiwi sitting here.
It will support me a bit in the presentation.

What I'm going to present is the outcomes of a European Union funded research project that is called also Kiwi Kiwi was standing for knowledge in a wiki, but we changed the focus of it and it's now a platform for building semantic social media applications.
The project has been running since March 2008 and it will now come to an end in February 2011, so I put the wrong date already.
It's a future.
I will briefly introduce into what was the vision so the project is.
Has its focus on enterprise knowledge management.

And I will present a bit about the vision, but the most interesting part to you will probably be the demonstration of the actual key system, because I think we have a lot of nice things to show in the really nice research prototype.
So knowledge management knowledge management is at least from a technical point of view, you have a lot of different kinds of resources which content you have media content.
You have text content, but you can also have things like software.
You can have.
Process is back reports and so on.
There's a lot of user in domain specific workflows, so every company has different workflows.
Every domain, especially his different workflows, and it's about sharing of content in color.
Nation of users.
And traditionally, knowledge management is something that is considered to be knowledge acquisition systems.

So you fill in forms and then this is stored somehow in the document management system you have predefined process is it's often part of the quality Mineta quality management activity of a company, and it's meant not in a negative way.
But it's meant to make people replaceable.
So if someone gets ill, you want to share the knowledge.
Or if someone goes into retirement, you want to be you want the knowledge to live on.

But the problem here is that most of the time technologists and manage is installer knowledge management systems and then people have to adapt by doing education and by requirements on quality management procedures and so on.
In the key way, we want technology and organization to be adaptable to the people, and Kiwi is actually Mendoza.
Content management system.
That follows this vision.

And the concept we are using is online communities in social software.

You can even write a book in a wiki.

You can connect things by drawing lines between the things you can draw on it.

So there's only workflows by social convention.

And the reason was to support the user.
